Description:
The FHIR Device resource describes information about durable, manufactured medical items. The Epic implementation of this resource currently supports only implantable medical devices.

The search interaction enables the client to query for implantable devices based on a specified set of information. The Device Search endpoint allows clients to establish an identifier for an implantable device without previously receiving unique identification from the server for the device. Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, this resource supports external medical device lookup using the _id parameter. External medical devices are not returned when using other search parameters. Any elements marked with an * in their description are returned for both implants and external devices, and all others are returned for implants only.
SampleResponse:
<Device xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<id value="ehrs9WMCpygyBmw-OHs-kuw3" />

<udi>

<deviceIdentifier value="34934579834" />

<name value="IMPLANT" />

<carrierHRF value="+34934579834/$$31810122/S140/16D20180907" />

<entryType value="unknown" />

</udi>

<status value="active" />

<type>

<coding>

<system value="http://snomed.com/" />

<code value="Nail" />

<display value="This is a Nail" />

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="http://genericwebsite.com" />

<code value="8675309" />

<display value="A long thin nail" />

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.10.737780.70" />

<code value="100" />

</coding>

</type>

<lotNumber value="2" />

<manufacturer value="RIS Pharmaceuticals" />

<manufactureDate value="2018-09-07" />

<expirationDate value="2018-10-12" />

<model value="239047ABC" />

<patient>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eNzTT5oTjKCVXqmpOhY-5nw3" />

<display value="Elena Q Kansi Esquire" />

</patient>

</Device>

device-name.Name: device-name
device-name.Description: A string that may match the device UDI name.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Patient identifier for the patient to whom the device is affixed.

udi-carrier.Name: udi-carrier
udi-carrier.Description: The UDI barcode string either in HRF format or AIDC format.

udi-di.Name: udi-di
udi-di.Description:
UDI device identifier.

Under FDA regulations, all medical devices are required to include a Unique Device Identifier (UDI) on device labels and packages, in both human-readable and barcode format. The FDA also maintains a public database of medical devices and UDI information called the Global Unique Device Identification Database (GUDID).

A Unique Device Identifier (UDI) is a unique numeric or alphanumeric code that is comprised of two components:

  • Device Identifier (DI) ("Static UDI") – a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifiers the labeler and specific version or model of a device.
  • Production Identifiers (PI) ("Dynamic UDI") – a conditional, variable portion of a UDI that identifies one or more of the following:
    • Lot or batch number within which a device was manufactured
    • Serial number of a specific device
    • Expiration date of a specific device
    • Production date of a specific device
    • Distinct identification code for a human cell, tissue, or cellular- and tissue-based product

When documenting a UDI for an implant in OpTime, you will need to use an identifier that is in a valid format for the selected issuer. Here are some example UDIs you can use for testing:

UDI Type / Issuer Example Device ID
ICCBBA W4184228005T0473
HIBC MDLXMAG120200
GS1 00822409025305

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: Serial number. Type hardcoded to SNO.*

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description: *Available in Netherlands environments only. This environment shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to the following canonical url: http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-MedicalDeviceProduct

status.Name: status
status.Description:
One of the following values:

  • active
  • inactive
  • entered-in-error
  • unknown

Configuration options for device status are available.

* For external devices, this is hard coded to a value of active.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
A SNOMED or other device code.

Configuration options for device type are available.*

entryType.Name: entryType
entryType.Description: This element is always set to a value of "unknown"
